metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36330 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in libwebp in versions before 1.0.1. An out-of-bounds read was found in function ChunkVerifyAndAssign. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and to the service availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwebp5 - 0.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwebpdemux1 - 0.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwebpmux1 - 0.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
webp - 0.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libwebp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
